alert.note: Alert for Eastern Norfolk; Northern Bristol; Southeast Middlesex; Suffolk; Western Norfolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 05 at 2:24PM EST until January 08 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...In the general vicinity of the Boston to Providence corridor. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult particularly Saturday night and again later Sunday morning and afternoon with a potential flash freeze. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow develops Saturday evening between 5 and 9 pm. The snow will become heavy at times and fall around 1 inch per hour for a time. The snow may mix with or even change to rain for a time by early Sunday. There then may be a lull in the precipitation early Sunday...before a second round of steady snow arrives later Sunday morning and afternoon. In addition...temps in the lower to middle 30s early Sunday will quickly drop into the 20s Sunday afternoon resulting in a flash freeze. So difficult travel will redevelop Sunday afternoon as temps crash.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
